intro: Hieracium serratum, commonly known as the serrated hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 centimeters and features serrated, lance-shaped leaves. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium serratum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
